medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient is a 75-year-old woman with a 6-year history of diffuse, severe pruritus without skin rash. Symptoms showed severe scratching lesions at the upper back and deltoid regions. The pruritus was persistent, but an elimination diet led to an 80% reduction after 10 days, with complete resolution one week later. Symptoms returned 3-4 days after resuming a normal diet and triggered by sodium benzoate during repeated challenges.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient had a history of Graves disease 20 years prior, leading to hypothyroidism treated with thyroxin.
